Migration.Name: Add Conditional Formatting logic to fields

PO.Data: Conditional formatting rules allow the field foreground and background colors to be changed based on logic conditions. The conditions are processed in order and the first "true" condition defines the formatting. The conditions can be defined on the Window, Tab and Field window as a subtab to the Field tab.
Select this checkbox to enable conditional formatting on this field.

Conditional formatting rules allow the field foreground and background colors to be changed based on logic conditions. The conditions are processed in order and the first "true" condition defines the formatting. The conditions can be defined on the Window, Tab and Field window as a subtab to the Field tab.
Select this checkbox to enable conditional formatting on this field.

Conditional formatting rules allow the field foreground and background colors to be changed based on logic conditions. The conditions are processed in order and the first "true" condition defines the formatting. The conditions can be defined on the Window, Tab and Field window as a subtab to the Field tab.
Select this checkbox to enable conditional formatting on this field.

Conditional formatting rules allow the field foreground and background colors to be changed based on logic conditions. The conditions are processed in order and the first "true" condition defines the formatting. The conditions can be defined on the Window, Tab and Field window as a subtab to the Field tab.
Select this checkbox to enable conditional formatting on this field.

Conditional formatting rules allow the field foreground and background colors to be changed based on logic conditions. The conditions are processed in order and the first "true" condition defines the formatting. The conditions can be defined on the Window, Tab and Field window as a subtab to the Field tab.
Select this checkbox to enable conditional formatting on this field.

format := {expression} [{logic} {expression}]
expression := @{context}@{operand}{value} or @{context}@{operand}{value}
logic := {|}|{&}
context := any global or window context
value := strings or numbers
logic operators := AND or OR with the previous result from left to right
operand := eq{=}, gt{>}, le{<}, not{~^!}
Examples:
@AD_Table_ID@=14 | @Language@!GERGER
@PriceLimit@>10 | @PriceList@>@PriceActual@
@Name@>J
Strings may be in single quotes (optional)
If the condition is true, the defined formats will be applied to the display of the field.

format := {expression} [{logic} {expression}]
expression := @{context}@{operand}{value} or @{context}@{operand}{value}
logic := {|}|{&}
context := any global or window context
value := strings or numbers
logic operators := AND or OR with the previous result from left to right
operand := eq{=}, gt{>}, le{<}, not{~^!}
Examples:
@AD_Table_ID@=14 | @Language@!GERGER
@PriceLimit@>10 | @PriceList@>@PriceActual@
@Name@>J
Strings may be in single quotes (optional)
If the condition is true, the defined formats will be applied to the display of the field.
The foreground color is used to display text or other foreground features.
Teh foreground color is used to display text or other foreground features.
The background color is used in the background, behind text and any other foreground elements.
The background color to be used.
The background color is used in the background, behind text and any other foreground elements.
The background color to be used.

Conditional formats for fields allow individual cells in a table/grid view to display foreground and background colors based on conditional logic. To apply, the field record (AD_Field) must have the IsConditionalFormat field selected.
A Client is a company or a legal entity. You cannot share data between Clients. Tenant is a synonym for Client.
An organization is a unit of your client or legal entity - examples are store, department. You can share data between organizations.

There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.
The record is active in the system
The Created field indicates the date that this record was created.
The Updated field indicates the date that this record was updated.
The Created By field indicates the user who created this record.
The Updated By field indicates the user who updated this record.
Method of ordering records; lowest number comes first
The Sequence indicates the order of records
The Field identifies a field on a database table.
If the condition is true, the defined formats will be applied to the display of the field.

format := {expression} [{logic} {expression}]
expression := @{context}@{operand}{value} or @{context}@{operand}{value}
logic := {|}|{&}
context := any global or window context
value := strings or numbers
logic operators := AND or OR with the previous result from left to right
operand := eq{=}, gt{>}, le{<}, not{~^!}
Examples:
@AD_Table_ID@=14 | @Language@!GERGER
@PriceLimit@>10 | @PriceList@>@PriceActual@
@Name@>J
Strings may be in single quotes (optional)
The foreground color is used to display text or other foreground features.
The background color to be used.
The background color is used in the background, behind text and any other foreground elements.

Data.oldValue: Sequence if the Fields in a Tab

PO.Data: Sequence of the Fields in a Tab
The foreground and background colors of the field displayed in a table can be selected based on logic conditions. This is similar to conditional formatting in spreadsheets.
Define formatting for fields based on conditions.
The foreground and background colors of the field displayed in a table can be selected based on logic conditions. This is similar to conditional formatting in spreadsheets.
Define formatting for fields based on conditions.

There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.
The record is active in the system

The background color is used in the background, behind text and any other foreground elements.
